thread.title: Coca Cola first in line as Twitter launches custom emojis for brands after releasing Star Wars icons
thread.title_full: Coca Cola first in line as Twitter launches custom emojis for brands after releasing Star Wars icons - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Coca Cola first in line as Twitter launches custom emojis for brands after releasing Star Wars icons
text:
Coca Cola has become the first brand to have its own custom emoji on Twitter.
The popular drink tweeted an emoji of two Coke bottles toasting alongside the hashtag #shareacoke.
Twitter has been experimenting with new emojis this year and already introduced Star Wars-themed ones to promote The Force Awakens.
But opening it up to brands could help the social network make money from partnerships.
Proud partners w/ @CocaCola : 1st to launch brand emojis. I want to #ShareACoke w @wnd https://t.co/Agl8Ka2BRO https://t.co/ry1n1foFh4
— adam bain (@adambain) September 17, 2015 "We know that people love using emojis and usage has been significantly increasing over time on our platform," said Ross Hoffman, the senior director of global brand strategy at Twitter.
"This was a perfect opportunity to work with a nimble and smart marketer to make this happen," he told TechCrunch .
"Micro-blogging" site Twitter isn't the only tech company experimenting with more emojis.
Tech fans have been left devastated after Apple's new iOS 9 operating system was released without a new range of emojis.
Angry Apple lovers have taken to Twitter to vent their fury at the "missing emojis", which include a controversial middle finger icon.
Some users really want this emoji
These new emotional icons were widely expected to be made available yesterday, when iOS 9 was released for download.
But they will actually come with the next version of Apple's mobile operating system, which is not released until later this year.
